content: round so that you have an odd number of stitches so knit the round increasing with a m1 anywhere on the first half of the stitches giving you 81 stitches all together the finished base should measure roughly 10 cm / 4 across as you can see i used a safety pin to mark the start of the rounds 2 the body of the bag change to the 6 5 mm needle yes really from now on the bag is worked in fabric stitch which is a very dense stitch pattern hence the big needles round 1 k1 *sl 1 pwise wyif k1 repeat from * to end round 2 sl 1 pwise wyif *k1 sl 1 pwise wyif repeat from * to end these two rounds make up the stitch pattern a few notes to bear in mind if you are using the magic loop method the two halves of each round will start differently because of the odd number of stitches watch out for slipped stitches hiding under the knit stitch next to it especially at the start of a needle work 59 rounds in this two round pattern by which time the patterned section should measure about 15 cm / 6 you can adjust the height of your bag here if necessary next round k2tog sl 1 pwise wyif *k1 sl 1 pwise wyif repeat from * to end 80 sts 3 i really like the textured look of this stitch pattern the inside of the bag is nice too a chunkier version of the outside the short handle this is worked back and forth on straight needles and to start with there s a bit of shaping to do on the slipped stitches the yarn is now held at the front of the work on knit row and at the back on purl row 1 sl 1pwise wyif k1 x 9 turn 18 sts row 2 p2tog sl 1 pwise wyib p1 x 8 17 sts row 3 sl 1 pwise wyif k1 x 7 sl 1 pwise wyif k2tog 16 sts row 4 sl 1 pwise wyib p1 x 8 row 5 sl 1 pwise wyif k1 x 8 row 6 p2tog sl 1 pwise wyib p1 x 7 15 sts row 7 sl 1 pwise wyif k1 x 6 sl 1 pwise wyif k2tog 14 sts row 8 sl 1 pwise wyib p1 x 7 now work 30 row following this two row pattern row 1 sl 1 pwise wyif k1 x 7 row 2 sl 1 pwise wyib p1 x 7 the handle should now measure roughly 10 cm / 4 long now for some increasing
